title: How to Give the Best Piggyback Rides

steps.title: Rider should place strongest arm around shoulder bone, using your shoulders to support the weight.
steps.content: Rider should place strongest arm around shoulder bone, using your shoulders to support the weight. Do not take weight off rider yet!

steps.title: Once arms are secure, bend your knees slightly reaching straight back with your arms.
steps.content: Once arms are secure, bend your knees slightly reaching straight back with your arms. As you reach down instruct the rider to gently take their weight with arms and bend their knees towards their hands.

steps.title: With your knees still bent, pull arms underneath riders legs to join your hands.
steps.content: With your knees still bent, pull arms underneath riders legs to join your hands. Keep your back straight. Interlock your fingers.

steps.title: Slowly raise the rider by straightening your knees.
steps.content: Slowly raise the rider by straightening your knees. Be careful as this is the point when you are most likely to overbalance. For a longer-lasting and more comfortable piggyback, adjust your arms to bring your elbows as close to your hips as possible, ideally this will transfer the weight from your arms into your hips.
